description: The Rainfed Area Development (RAD) scheme, launched in 2014-15, aims to enhance productivity in rainfed areas through an Integrated Farming System (IFS), minimizing risks from climatic variability and ensuring sustainable livelihoods.
key_features: Promotes Integrated Farming System with crops, horticulture, livestock, fishery, and agro-forestry
Focuses on soil and water conservation
Leverages resources from other schemes like MGNREGS, PMKSY, and NFSM
Capacity building for farmers on climate-resilient practices

benefits.productivity_improvement: Enhanced farm productivity through diversified farming
benefits.risk_mitigation: Income from allied activities during crop failure

criteria: Priority to small and marginal farmers

steps: Contact local agriculture department or Krishi Vigyan Kendra
Verification and approval by district authorities

special_notes: Implemented through convergence with other schemes
Focus on local market-driven value chains
